intro: Ferula cappadocica, commonly known as Cappadocian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Turkey and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Ferula cappadocica is often found in rocky and arid environments, adapting well to poor soils and harsh climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
